content:
The "Biodiesel Energy Development Act of 1997" includes provisions for alternative fuels, such as definitions, amendments to the Energy Policy and Conservation Act, minimum Federal fleet requirements, state and local incentives programs, alternative fuel bus programs, and alternative fuel use in nonroad vehicles, engines, and marine vessels. The "Biodiesel Energy Development Act of 1997" includes provisions for alternative fuels, such as definitions, replacement fuel supply program, fleet requirement program, credits, and Secretary's recommendation to Congress. Section 301 of the Energy Policy Act of 1992 is amended to include requirements for domestically produced renewable biological materials in fuel mixtures, expand the types of vehicles capable of using alternative fuels, and reorganize existing paragraphs while adding new ones. The Energy Policy Act of 1992 is amended to include definitions for heavy duty motor vehicles and marine vessels, as well as specifying the use of domestically produced renewable biological materials in fuel mixtures. Amendments to the Energy Policy and Conservation Act include definitions for heavy duty motor vehicles and marine vessels, as well as the use of domestically produced renewable biological materials in fuel mixtures. Amendments to the Energy Policy and Conservation Act allow for existing fleet vehicles to be converted to use alternative fuels during major overhauls or rebuilds, or for the acquisition of vehicles already converted to use alternative fuels. Additionally, renewable biological materials, including biodiesel, must be used in fuel mixtures at a minimum of 20 percent by volume. Amendments to the Energy Policy and Conservation Act allow for existing fleet vehicles to be converted to use alternative fuels during major overhauls or rebuilds. This includes motor vehicles and marine vessels capable of operating on alternative fuel, gasoline, or diesel fuel. Additionally, renewable biological materials, such as biodiesel, must be used in fuel mixtures at a minimum of 20 percent by volume. Amendments to the Energy Policy and Conservation Act allow for existing fleet vehicles to be converted to use alternative fuels during major overhauls or rebuilds. This includes motor vehicles and marine vessels capable of operating on alternative fuel, gasoline, or diesel fuel. Additionally, renewable biological materials, such as biodiesel, must be used in fuel mixtures at a minimum of 20 percent by volume. Minimum Federal Fleet Requirement. Amendments to the Energy Policy Act of 1992 allow Federal fleets to acquire heavy duty alternative fueled vehicles as compliance credits. One heavy duty vehicle can replace two light duty alternative fueled vehicles. Additional credits can be obtained for documented purchases. Amendments to the Energy Policy Act of 1992 allow Federal fleets to acquire heavy duty alternative fueled vehicles as compliance credits. Additional credits can be obtained for documented purchases of alternative fuel used in dual-fueled vehicles, conventionally-fueled motor vehicles, or marine vessels. The Secretary may request a Federal agency to provide an accounting of the purchase, and guidelines for this request will be included in the required guidelines. The Secretary will implement this subsection in a manner that is neutral with respect to the type of fuel and vehicle used. TITLE II--ALTERNATIVE FUELS--NON-FEDERAL PROGRAMS
SEC. 201. STATE AND LOCAL INCENTIVES PROGRAMS. The Energy Policy Act of 1992 is amended to include light and heavy duty alternative fueled vehicles and increase the use of alternative fuels. This includes incentives towards the use of alternative fuels and reporting requirements. The Energy Policy Act of 1992 is amended to provide federal financial assistance for the incremental purchase cost of alternative fuels and to increase the use of alternative fuels in vehicles. The Energy Policy Act of 1992 is amended to include provisions for the procurement of alternative fuels and the volume of alternative fuel consumed in vehicles. The Energy Policy Act of 1992 is amended to include provisions for alternative fuel bus programs and the use of alternative fuels in nonroad vehicles, engines, and marine vessels. Section 412 of the Energy Policy Act of 1992 is amended to include provisions for vehicles, engines, and marine vessels. Section 412 of the Energy Policy Act of 1992 is amended to include provisions for vehicles, engines, and marine vessels by adjusting time frames and language used in the original text. The Energy Policy Act of 1992 is amended to include provisions for vehicles, engines, and marine vessels by adjusting language and time frames. Title III of the Energy Policy Act of 1992 includes a mandate for alternative fuel providers. SEC. 301 of the Energy Policy Act of 1992 mandates alternative fuel providers to allow the conversion of existing fleet vehicles into dual-fueled alternative fueled vehicles during major overhauls or rebuilds, as long as the original equipment manufacturer's warranty still applies. SEC. 302 of the Energy Policy Act of 1992 amends Section 502 to include heavy vehicles in the fuel supply program and requires updates every 5 years until 2008. SEC. 303 of the Energy Policy Act of 1992 modifies goals and grants additional rulemaking authority, ensuring new regulations are fuel and vehicle neutral. The Energy Policy Act of 1992 is amended to include goals for fleet program purchases, requirements for fleet programs, and rules for substitutions in vehicle acquisitions. The Energy Policy Act of 1992 is amended to allow fleet owners to convert existing vehicles into alternative fueled vehicles for compliance with the Act, as long as the original manufacturer's warranty still applies. The Energy Policy Act of 1992 is amended to allow fleet owners to convert existing vehicles into alternative fueled vehicles and purchase alternative fuel for compliance with the Act. Additionally, mandatory state fleet programs are updated to include new light or heavy duty alternative fueled vehicles. SEC. 305. CREDITS. Section 508(a) of the Energy Policy Act of 1992 is amended to include additional alternative fueled vehicles and allocate credits for acquiring alternative fuel for dual-fueled vehicles. Section 508(a) of the Energy Policy Act of 1992 is amended to include credits for acquiring alternative fuel for dual-fueled vehicles, allocating 2 credits for acquiring or converting a dual-fueled vehicle and acquiring alternative fuel equal to the estimated need for 1 year. SEC. 306 of the Energy Policy Act of 1992 is amended to recommend exempting replacement fuels from taxes on non-replacement fuels and includes provisions for the conversion and warranty of motor vehicles into alternative fueled vehicles.
